analyzed: aham hare tava pāda eka mūla dāsa anudāsaḥ bhavitāsmi bhūyas

translated: O Lord, may I, whose mind is attached to the self, children, wife, and home due to your illusion, not be so.

analyzed: śrī ṛṣiḥ uvāca
translated: The sage said:

analyzed: evam jihāsuḥ nṛpa deham ājau mṛtyum varam vijayāt manyamānaḥ
translated: Thus, O king, desiring to give up the body in battle, considering death preferable to victory,

original: śūlaṃ pragṛhyābhyapatat surendraṃ yathā mahāpuruṣaṃ kaiṭabho 'psu
analyzed: śūlam pragṛhya abhyapatat sura indram yathā mahā puruṣam kaiṭabha upsu

analyzed: tat niḥsārya upaharaṇam dattvā ācamanam arcayet
translated: and having removed the offering, one should offer water for rinsing the mouth and worship.

analyzed: tatas stuvīta stotreṇa bhakti prahveṇa cetasā
translated: Then one should praise with a hymn, with a mind humble with devotion.

original: yajñocchiṣṭamavaghrāya punarabhyarcayeddharim🔽patiṃ ca parayā bhaktyā mahāpuruṣacetasā
analyzed: yajña ucchiṣṭam avaghrāya punar abhyarcayet harim  patim ca parayā bhaktyā mahāpuruṣa cetasā
translated: Having sniffed the remnants of the sacrifice, one should again worship Hari.🔽And with great devotion, with the mind of the Supreme Person, one should serve one's husband.

analyzed: priyaiḥ taiḥ taiḥ upanamet prema śīlaḥ svayam patiḥ
translated: The husband, who is naturally affectionate, should serve with those very things that are dear.

analyzed: bibhṛyāt sarva karmāṇi patnyāḥ uccāvacāni ca
translated: He should perform all the duties, high and low, along with his wife.

analyzed: kṛtam ekatareṇa api dampatyoḥ ubhayoḥ api
translated: Even if done by one of the couple, it is done by both husband and wife.

analyzed: patnyām kuryāt anarhāyām patiḥ etat samāhitaḥ
translated: The husband, with a focused mind, should perform this for his deserving wife.

analyzed: viṣṇoḥ vratam idam bibhran na vihanyāt kathañcana
translated: Bearing this vow of Vishnu, one should never violate it in any way.

analyzed: viprān striyaḥ vīravatīḥ sraj gandha bali maṇḍanaiḥ
translated: The virtuous wife, observing the vow, should worship the Lord every day with devotion, with garlands, scents, offerings, and ornaments,

original: arcedaharaharbhaktyā devaṃ niyamamāsthitā🔽udvāsya devaṃ sve dhāmni tanniveditamagrataḥ
analyzed: arcet aharahar bhaktyā devam niyamam āsthitā  udvāsya devam sve dhāmni tat niveditam agratas
translated: and with women Brahmins who have borne heroic sons.

original: adyādātmaviśuddhyarthaṃ sarvakāmasamṛddhaye🔽etena pūjāvidhinā māsān dvādaśa hāyanam
analyzed: adyāt ātma viśuddhi artham sarva kāma samṛddhaye  etena pūjā vidhinā māsān dvādaśa hāyanam
translated: Having dismissed the Lord to His own abode, she should eat the food offered to Him, for the purification of her soul and the fulfillment of all desires.

analyzed: nītvā atha uparamet sādhvī kārtike carame hani
translated: Having spent twelve years in this manner of worship, the virtuous wife should then cease on the last day of the month of Kārttika.

original: śvobhūte 'pa upaspṛśya kṛṣṇamabhyarcya pūrvavat🔽payaḥśṛtena juhuyāc caruṇā saha sarpiṣā🔽pākayajñavidhānena dvādaśaivāhutīḥ patiḥ
analyzed: śvobhūte paḥ upaspṛśya kṛṣṇam abhyarcya pūrvavat  payaḥ śṛtena juhuyāt caruṇā saha sarpiṣā  pākayajña vidhānena dvādaśa eva āhutīḥ patiḥ
translated: The next day, having touched water and worshipped Kṛṣṇa as before,🔽the husband should offer twelve oblations with ghee and cooked rice boiled in milk,

original: āśiṣaḥ śirasādāya dvijaiḥ prītaiḥ samīritāḥ🔽praṇamya śirasā bhaktyā bhuñjīta tadanujñayā
analyzed: āśiṣaḥ śirasā ādāya dvijaiḥ prītaiḥ samīritāḥ  praṇamya śirasā bhaktyā bhuñjīta tad anujñayā
translated: in accordance with the rules of the Pākayajña.🔽Having accepted the blessings proclaimed by the pleased Brahmins,🔽he should eat with their permission, bowing his head in devotion,

analyzed: ācāryam agratas kṛtvā vāgyataḥ saha bandhubhiḥ
translated: with his wife and relatives, observing silence.

original: dadyāt patnyai caroḥ śeṣaṃ suprajāstvaṃ susaubhagam
analyzed: dadyāt patnyai caroḥ śeṣam suprajāstvam su saubhagam
translated: He should give the remaining food to his wife, for good offspring and good fortune.

original: etac caritvā vidhivadvrataṃ vibhor abhīpsitārthaṃ labhate pumān iha
analyzed: etat caritvā vidhivat vratam vibhoḥ abhīpsita artham labhate pumān iha
translated: Having thus duly observed the vow of the Lord, a man obtains his desired object in this world.

original: strī caitadāsthāya labheta saubhagaṃ śriyaṃ prajāṃ jīvapatiṃ yaśo gṛham
analyzed: strī ca etat āsthāya labheta saubhagam śriyam prajām jīvapatim yaśaḥ gṛham
translated: A woman, having resorted to this, would obtain good fortune, prosperity, offspring, a living husband, fame, and a home.

original: kanyā ca vindeta samagralakṣaṇaṃ patiṃ tvavīrā hatakilbiṣāṃ gatim
analyzed: kanyā ca vindeta samagra lakṣaṇam patim tu avīrā hata kilbiṣām gatim
translated: And a maiden would find a husband with all the auspicious marks, and a childless woman would attain the state of having her sins destroyed.

original: mṛtaprajā jīvasutā dhaneśvarī sudurbhagā subhagā rūpamagryam
analyzed: mṛta prajā jīva sutā dhana īśvarī su durbhagā subhagā rūpam agryam
translated: A woman with dead children would have living children, a poor woman would become wealthy, an unfortunate woman would become fortunate, and an ugly woman would obtain the highest beauty.

analyzed: vindet virūpāḥ virujā vimucyate yaḥ āmayāvī indriya kalya deham
translated: An ugly woman would become beautiful, and one afflicted with disease would be freed. One suffering from illness would obtain a body with healthy senses.

original: etat paṭhannabhyudaye ca karmaṇy anantatṛptiḥ pitṛdevatānām
analyzed: etat paṭhan abhyudaye ca karmaṇi ananta tṛptiḥ pitṛ devatānām
translated: One who recites this, at an auspicious rite, obtains endless satisfaction for the ancestors and gods.

original: tuṣṭāḥ prayacchanti samastakāmān homāvasāne hutabhuk śrīhariśca
analyzed: tuṣṭāḥ prayacchanti samasta kāmān homa avasāne hutabhuj śrī hariḥ ca
translated: Being pleased, they grant all desires. At the end of the oblation, the sacrificial fire and Lord Hari are pleased.

original: rājan mahan marutāṃ janma puṇyaṃ ditervrataṃ cābhihitaṃ mahat te
analyzed: rājan mahat marutām janma puṇyam diteḥ vratam ca abhihitam mahat te
translated: O King, the auspicious birth of the Maruts and the great vow of Diti have been narrated to you.
